description:
World Sport from the BBC with Alastair Ross coming up in the next ten minutes. Real Madrid edge towards the final eight of the Champions League. We'll get the latest on the current ongoing game at the Cricket World Cup. And we'll hear what Lorry Michael Lawrie thinks of Europe's Ryder Cup captain choice.

"played a lot of Ryder Cup's open champion, has been a part of the team for so many years, couldn't think of a better guy to play under 2016."

But we start with football, and Real Madrid have taken a giant step into the last eight of the Champions League, with a 2-0 win at Schalke in the first leg of their last 16 tie. A late penalty in Wednesday's other game gave Porto a deserved 1-1 draw in their first leg of the game at Swiss side Basel. The BBC's John Bennet was watching both matches for us.

"Well, Real Madrid have equaled the longest winning run in champions league history, ten wins in a row, and more good news for them Ronaldo ended his goal drought. First goal since the 18th of January, it had been four hours and 59 minutes without a goal for Ronaldo, three games. For him, that's a long stretch because he's now scored 58 goals in 58 champions league games for Real Madrid, he's the first player in champions league history to score in 12 consecutive away games."
